newsitem.title: JORDAN: Palestinians urge Jordan to put pressure on Israel.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians urge Jordan to put pressure on Israel.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat has urged King Hussein of Jordan to join in concerted efforts to halt an Israeli settlement drive in Palestinian territories, a senior Palestinian official said on Sunday.

Palestinian negotiator Saeb Erekat said the message was conveyed in a letter he handed to Prime Minister Abdul-Salam al-Majali from Arafat for King Hussein on the latest developments in the peace process after a mission to the region by U.S. Middle East envoy Dennis Ross.

"The letter called for Arab and international coordination to stop Israel's settlement policy and the need to work together to put an end to Israel's practices before it's too late," Erekat told Reuters after talks in Amman.
Erekat also handed Majali a file of all Israeli settlement activities since January this year.
Majali was quoted by the state news agency Petra as saying Jordan reiterated to Erekat his country's "firm support" to the Palestinians in their right to national self-determination.
Israel and the Palestinians are refusing to budge from positions which froze on March 18 when Israel broke ground on a new Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
The Palestinians demand Israel halt all settlement activity, which they see as an attempt to pre-empt final peace talks, as a condition to resuming negotiations.
